trans-unit.source: This filter primitive produces an image which contains the specular reflection part of the lighting calculation. Such a map is intended to be combined with a texture using the add term of the arithmetic <feComposite> method. Multiple light sources can be simulated by adding several of these light maps before applying it to the texture image.
trans-unit.target: Esta primitiva de filtro produce una imagen que contiene la parte de reflexión especular del cálculo de iluminación. Dicho mapa está destinado a ser combinado con una textura usando el add plazo de la aritmética <feComposite> método. Se pueden simular múltiples fuentes de luz agregando varios de estos mapas de luz antes de aplicarlos a la imagen de textura.

trans-unit.source: This image shows just the desired effect.
trans-unit.target: Esta imagen muestra sólo el efecto deseado.

trans-unit.source: This is a JavaScript library, that acts as an abstraction layer between browser implementations. Notably older versions of Internet Explorer are supported by generating VML, a vector markup language, that is one of two ancestors of SVG and exists since IE 5.5.
trans-unit.target: Esta es una biblioteca de JavaScript,que actúa como una capa de abstracción entre las implementaciones de los navegadores.En particular,las versiones más antiguas de Internet Explorer son compatibles con la generación de VML,un lenguaje de marcado de vectores,que es uno de los dos antepasados de SVG y existe desde IE 5.5.

trans-unit.source: This is a list of feature strings, separated using white space. Determines whether all of the named features are supported by the browser. See Feature strings below for a list of allowed values.
trans-unit.target: Esta es una lista de cadenas de características, separadas por espacios en blanco. Determina si todas las funciones nombradas son compatibles con el navegador. Consulte Cadenas de funciones a continuación para obtener una lista de valores permitidos.

trans-unit.source: This is a more obscure attribute giving the calculated length of the string. It is meant to allow the rendering engine to fine-tune the positions of the glyphs when its own measured text length doesn't meet the one provided here.

This is a more obscure attribute giving the calculated length of the string. It is meant to allow the rendering engine to fine-tune the positions of the glyphs. when its own measured text length doesn't meet the one provided here.
trans-unit.target: Este es un atributo más oscuro que da la longitud calculada de la cadena.Está pensado para permitir que el motor de representación afine las posiciones de los glifos cuando su propia longitud de texto medida no se ajusta a la proporcionada aquí.

trans-unit.source: This is done adding an SVG element like <animate> inside the SVG element to animate. Below are examples for the four different ways.
trans-unit.target: Esto se hace agregando un elemento SVG como <animate> dentro del elemento SVG para animar. A continuación se muestran ejemplos de las cuatro formas diferentes.

trans-unit.source: This is the default behavior. All colors are presumed to be defined in the sRGB color space unless a more precise embedded profile is specified within content data. For images that do have a profile built into their data, that profile is used. For images that do not have a profile, the sRGB profile is used.
trans-unit.target: Este es el comportamiento por defecto.Se presume que todos los colores están definidos en el espacio de color sRGB a menos que se especifique un perfil incrustado más preciso dentro de los datos de contenido.Para las imágenes que sí tienen un perfil incorporado en sus datos,se utiliza ese perfil.Para las imágenes que no tienen un perfil,se utiliza el perfil sRGB.

trans-unit.source: This keyword denotes the current fill color and can be specified in the same manner as within a <paint> specification for the fill and stroke attributes.
This keyword represents an image snapshot of the SVG document under the filter region at the time that the <filter> element was invoked.
trans-unit.target: Esta palabra clave representa una instantánea de la imagen del documento SVG debajo de la región del filtro en el momento en que se invocó el elemento <filter> .

trans-unit.source: This keyword represents an image snapshot of the SVG document under the filter region at the time that the <filter> element was invoked.
This keyword represents the graphics elements that were the original input into the <filter> element.
trans-unit.target: Esta palabra clave representa los elementos gráficos que fueron la entrada original en el elemento <filter> .

trans-unit.source: This keyword represents the graphics elements that were the original input into the <filter> element. SourceAlpha has all of the same rules as SourceGraphic except that only the alpha channel is used.
trans-unit.target: Esta palabra clave representa los elementos gráficos que fueron la entrada original en el elemento <filter> . SourceAlpha tiene todas las mismas reglas que SourceGraphic excepto que solo se usa el canal alfa.

trans-unit.source: This keyword represents the graphics elements that were the original input into the <filter> element. SourceAlpha has all of the same rules as SourceGraphic except that only the alpha channel is used.

This keyword represents the value of the fill property on the target element for the filter effect. In many cases, the FillPaint is opaque everywhere, but it might not be the case if a shape is paint with a gradient or pattern which itself includes transparent or semi-transparent parts.
trans-unit.target: Esta palabra clave representa el valor de la propiedad de fill en el elemento de destino para el efecto de filtro. En muchos casos, FillPaint es opaco en todas partes, pero puede que no sea el caso si una forma es pintura con un degradado o patrón que a su vez incluye partes transparentes o semitransparentes.

trans-unit.source: This keyword represents the value of the fill property on the target element for the filter effect. In many cases, the FillPaint is opaque everywhere, but that might not be the case if a shape is painted with a gradient or pattern which itself includes transparent or semi-transparent parts.
trans-unit.target: Esta palabra clave representa el valor de la propiedad de fill en el elemento de destino para el efecto de filtro. En muchos casos, FillPaint es opaco en todas partes, pero ese podría no ser el caso si una forma está pintada con un degradado o patrón que a su vez incluye partes transparentes o semitransparentes.

trans-unit.source: This keyword represents the value of the stroke property on the target element for the filter effect. In many cases, the StrokePaint is opaque everywhere, but it might not be the case if a shape is paint with a gradient or pattern which itself includes transparent or semi-transparent parts.
trans-unit.target: Esta palabra clave representa el valor de la propiedad de stroke en el elemento de destino para el efecto de filtro. En muchos casos, StrokePaint es opaco en todas partes, pero podría no ser el caso si una forma es pintura con un degradado o patrón que a su vez incluye partes transparentes o semitransparentes.

trans-unit.source: This keyword represents the value of the stroke property on the target element for the filter effect. In many cases, the StrokePaint is opaque everywhere, but that might not be the case if a shape is painted with a gradient or pattern which itself includes transparent or semi-transparent parts.
trans-unit.target: Esta palabra clave representa el valor de la propiedad de stroke en el elemento de destino para el efecto de filtro. En muchos casos, StrokePaint es opaco en todas partes, pero ese podría no ser el caso si una forma está pintada con un degradado o patrón que a su vez incluye partes transparentes o semitransparentes.

trans-unit.source: This keyword specifies that the alpha channel of the input image defined in in2 will be used to displace the pixels of the input image defined in in along the x-axis.
This keyword specifies that the alpha channel of the input image defined in in2 will be used to displace the pixels of the input image defined in in along the y-axis.
This keyword specifies that the blue color channel of the input image defined in in2 will be used to displace the pixels of the input image defined in in along the x-axis.
This keyword specifies that the blue color channel of the input image defined in in2 will be used to displace the pixels of the input image defined in in along the y-axis.
This keyword specifies that the green color channel of the input image defined in in2 will be used to displace the pixels of the input image defined in in along the x-axis.
This keyword specifies that the green color channel of the input image defined in in2 will be used to displace the pixels of the input image defined in in along the y-axis.
This keyword specifies that the red color channel of the input image defined in in2 will be used to displace the pixels of the input image defined in in along the x-axis.
This keyword specifies that the red color channel of the input image defined in in2 will be used to displace the pixels of the input image defined in in along the y-axis.

This language is used for all instances of style that do not specify their own styling language, such as the style attribute that is available on many elements. The value specifies a media type, per MIME Part Two: Media Types [RFC2046].
This only works if the previous command was a Q or a T command. If not, then the control point is assumed to be the same as the previous point, and only lines will be drawn.
This only works if the previous command was a Q or a T command. If it is not, then the control point is assumed to be the same as the previous point, and you'll only draw lines.
trans-unit.target: Esto sólo funciona si el comando anterior era un comando Q o T.Si no lo es,entonces se supone que el punto de control es el mismo que el anterior,y sólo se dibujarán líneas.

trans-unit.source: This page illustrates the application of CSS to the specialized language for creating graphics: SVG.
trans-unit.target: Esta página ilustra la aplicación de CSS al lenguaje especializado para la creación de gráficos: SVG .

trans-unit.source: This page illustrates the application of CSS to the specialized language for creating graphics: SVG.
This shortcut looks at the previous control point used and infers a new one from it. This means that after the first control point, fairly complex shapes can be made by specifying only end points.

This shortcut looks at the previous control point you used and infers a new one from it. This means that after your first control point, you can make fairly complex shapes by specifying only end points.
trans-unit.target: Este atajo mira el punto de control anterior que usaste e infiere uno nuevo a partir de él.Esto significa que después de tu primer punto de control,puedes hacer formas bastante complejas especificando sólo los puntos finales.

trans-unit.source: This specifies that the animation function will jump from one value to the next without any interpolation.
trans-unit.target: Esto especifica que la función de animación saltará de un valor a otro sin ninguna interpolación.

trans-unit.source: This specifies that the value of attributeName is the name of a CSS property defined as animatable.
trans-unit.target: Esto especifica que el valor de attributeName es el nombre de una propiedad CSS definida como animable.

trans-unit.source: This specifies that the value of attributeName is the name of an XML attribute defined as animatable in the default XML namespace for the target element.
trans-unit.target: Esto especifica que el valor de attributeName es el nombre de un atributo XML definido como animable en el espacio de nombres XML predeterminado para el elemento de destino.

trans-unit.source: This syntax is the same as the definition in CSS (CSS2, section 4.3.1).
trans-unit.target: Esta sintaxis es la misma que la definición en el CSS (CSS2,sección 4.3.1).

trans-unit.source: This tutorial aims to explain the internals of SVG and is packed with technical details. If you just want to draw beautiful images, you might find more useful resources at Inkscape's documentation page. Another good introduction to SVG is provided by the W3C's SVG Primer.
trans-unit.target: Este tutorial tiene como objetivo explicar los aspectos internos de SVG y está repleto de detalles técnicos. Si solo desea dibujar imágenes hermosas, puede encontrar recursos más útiles en la página de documentación de Inkscape . Otra buena introducción a SVG la proporciona el SVG Primer del W3C .

trans-unit.source: This value defines a clock-value that represents a point in time relative to the beginning of the SVG document (usually the load or DOMContentLoaded event). Negative values are valid.
This value defines a clock-value that represents a point in time relative to the beginning of the SVG document (usually the load or DOMContentLoaded event). Negative values are valid.
This value defines a syncbase and an optional offset from that syncbase. The element's animation end time is defined relative to the begin or active end of another animation.
This value defines a syncbase and an optional offset from that syncbase. The element's animation start time is defined relative to the begin or active end of another animation.
This value defines a left-to-right block flow direction. Both the writing mode and the typographic mode are vertical.
This value defines a qualified repeat event. The element animation end time is defined relative to the time that the repeat event is raised with the specified iteration value.
This value defines a qualified repeat event. The element animation start time is defined relative to the time that the repeat event is raised with the specified iteration value.
This value defines a right-to-left block flow direction. Both the writing mode and the typographic mode are vertical.
This value defines a top-to-bottom block flow direction. Both the writing mode and the typographic mode are horizontal.
This value defines an access key that should trigger the animation. The element animation will begin when the user presses the specified key.
This value defines an access key that should trigger the end of the animation. The element animation will end when the user presses the specified key.

This value defines an event and an optional offset that determines the time at which the element's animation should begin. The animation start time is defined relative to the time that the specified event is fired.

This value defines an event and an optional offset that determines the time at which the element's animation should end. The animation end time is defined relative to the time that the specified event is fired.
This value defines either an absolute or a relative height of the marker.
This value defines either an absolute or a relative width of the marker.
This value defines the animation end time as a real-world clock time.
This value defines the animation start time as a real-world clock time.
This value defines the divisor. If the specified divisor is 0 then the default value will be used instead.
This value defines the height of the marker in the units defined by the markerUnits attribute.
This value defines the scale factor for the displacement.
This value defines the width of the marker in the units defined by the markerUnits attribute.
This value fattens the source graphic defined in the in attribute.
This value indicates a color value.
This value indicates that all coordinates for the geometry attributes refer to the user coordinate system as defined when the mask was created.
trans-unit.target: Este valor indica que todas las coordenadas de los atributos de la geometría se refieren al sistema de coordenadas del usuario tal como se definió cuando se creó la máscara.

trans-unit.source: This value indicates that all coordinates for the geometry attributes represent fractions or percentages of the bounding box of the element to which the mask is applied. A bounding box could be considered the same as if the content of the <mask> were bound to a "0 0 1 1" viewbox.
trans-unit.target: Este valor indica que todas las coordenadas de los atributos de geometría representan fracciones o porcentajes del cuadro delimitador del elemento al que se aplica la máscara. Un cuadro delimitador podría considerarse lo mismo que si el contenido de la <mask> estuviera vinculado a un viewbox " 0 0 1 1 " .

trans-unit.source: This value indicates that all coordinates for the geometry preoperties refer to the user coordinate system as defined when the pattern was applied.
trans-unit.target: Este valor indica que todas las coordenadas de las preoperancias de la geometría se refieren al sistema de coordenadas del usuario tal como se definió cuando se aplicó el patrón.

trans-unit.source: This value indicates that all coordinates for the geometry properties refer to the user coordinate system as defined when the pattern was applied.

This value indicates that all coordinates for the geometry properties represent fractions or percentages of the bounding box of the element to which the mask is applied. A bounding box could be considered the same as if the content of the <mask> were bound to a "0 0 1 1" viewbox.
trans-unit.target: Este valor indica que todas las coordenadas de las propiedades geométricas representan fracciones o porcentajes del cuadro delimitador del elemento al que se aplica la máscara. Un cuadro delimitador podría considerarse lo mismo que si el contenido de la <mask> estuviera vinculado a un viewbox " 0 0 1 1 " .

trans-unit.source: This value indicates that all coordinates inside the <clipPath> element are relative to the bounding box of the element the clipping path is applied to. It means that the origin of the coordinate system is the top left corner of the object bounding box and the width and height of the object bounding box are considered to have a length of 1 unit value.
trans-unit.target: Este valor indica que todas las coordenadas dentro del elemento <clipPath> son relativas al cuadro delimitador del elemento al que se aplica el trazado de recorte. Significa que el origen del sistema de coordenadas es la esquina superior izquierda del cuadro delimitador del objeto y se considera que el ancho y la altura del cuadro delimitador del objeto tienen una longitud de valor de 1 unidad.

trans-unit.source: This value indicates that all coordinates inside the <clipPath> element refer to the user coordinate system as defined when the clipping path was created.
trans-unit.target: Este valor indica que todas las coordenadas dentro del elemento <clipPath> se refieren al sistema de coordenadas del usuario definido cuando se creó la ruta de recorte.

trans-unit.source: This value indicates that all coordinates inside the <mask> element are relative to the bounding box of the element the mask is applied to. A bounding box could be considered the same as if the content of the <mask> were bound to a "0 0 1 1" viewbox.
trans-unit.target: Este valor indica que todas las coordenadas dentro del elemento <mask> son relativas al cuadro delimitador del elemento al que se aplica la máscara. Un cuadro delimitador podría considerarse lo mismo que si el contenido de la <mask> estuviera vinculado a un viewbox " 0 0 1 1 " .

trans-unit.source: This value indicates that all coordinates inside the <mask> element refer to the user coordinate system as defined when the mask was created.
trans-unit.target: Este valor indica que todas las coordenadas dentro del elemento <mask> se refieren al sistema de coordenadas del usuario definido cuando se creó la máscara.

trans-unit.source: This value indicates that all coordinates inside the <pattern> element are relative to the bounding box of the element the pattern is applied to. A bounding box could be considered the same as if the content of the <pattern> were bound to a "0 0 1 1" viewbox for a pattern tile of width and height of 100%.
trans-unit.target: Este valor indica que todas las coordenadas dentro del elemento <pattern> son relativas al cuadro delimitador del elemento al que se aplica el patrón. Un cuadro delimitador podría considerarse lo mismo que si el contenido del <pattern> estuviera vinculado a un viewbox de visualización " 0 0 1 1 " para un mosaico de patrón de ancho y alto del 100%.

trans-unit.source: This value indicates that all coordinates inside the <pattern> element refer to the user coordinate system as defined when the pattern tile was created.
trans-unit.target: Este valor indica que todas las coordenadas dentro del elemento <pattern> se refieren al sistema de coordenadas del usuario definido cuando se creó el mosaico del patrón.

trans-unit.source: This value indicates that any length values within the filter definitions represent fractions or percentages of the bounding box on the referencing element.

This value indicates that any length values within the filter definitions represent values in the current user coordinate system in place at the time when the <filter> element is referenced (i.e., the user coordinate system for the element referencing the <filter> element via a filter attribute).

This value indicates that no attempt is made to achieve smooth transitions at the border of tiles which contain a turbulence function. Sometimes the result will show clear discontinuities at the tile borders.
This value indicates that other markup present in the link, i.e. the target attribute, determines its behavior.

This value indicates that resources external to the current document are optional. Document rendering can proceed even if external resources are unavailable to the current element and its descendants.

This value indicates that resources external to the current document are required. If an external resource is not available, progressive rendering is suspended, the document's SVGLoad event is not fired and the animation timeline does not begin until that resource and all other required resources become available, have been parsed and are ready to be rendered.
This value indicates that the animation can be restarted at any time.
This value indicates that the animation can only be restarted when it is not active (i.e. after the active end). Attempts to restart the animation during its active duration are ignored.
This value indicates that the animation cannot be restarted for the time the document is loaded.
This value indicates that the animation will be repeated indefinitely (i.e. until the document ends).

This value indicates that the attributes represent values in the coordinate system that results from taking the current user coordinate system in place at the time when the gradient element is referenced (i.e., the user coordinate system for the element referencing the gradient element via a fill or stroke property) and then applying the transform specified by attribute gradientTransform.
This value indicates that the convolution will apply to all channels, including the alpha channel.
This value indicates that the convolution will only apply to the color channels. In this case, the filter will temporarily unpremultiply the color component values and apply the kernel.
This value indicates that the element will be painted.

This value indicates that the element will not be painted. Though it is still part of the rendering tree, i.e. it may receive pointer events depending on the pointer-events attribute, may receive focus depending on the tabindex attribute, contributes to bounding box calculations and clipping paths, and does affect text layout.
This value indicates that the fill will be painted first, then the stroke, and finally the markers.
This value indicates that the final color of the gradient fills the shape beyond the gradient's edges.
This value indicates that the gradient repeats in reverse beyond its edges.
This value indicates that the input image is extended along each of its borders as necessary by duplicating the color values at the given edge of the input image.
This value indicates that the input image is extended by taking the color values from the opposite edge of the image.
This value indicates that the input image is extended with pixel values of zero for R, G, B and A.
This value indicates that the non-overlapping regions of the source graphic defined in the in attribute and the destination graphic defined in the in2 attribute are combined.
This value indicates that the parts of the source graphic defined in the in attribute that fall outside the destination graphic defined in the in2 attribute, are displayed.
This value indicates that the parts of the source graphic defined in the in attribute that overlap the destination graphic defined in the in2 attribute, replace the destination graphic.

This value indicates that the parts of the source graphic defined in the in attribute, which overlap the destination graphic defined in the in2 attribute, replace the destination graphic. The parts of the destination graphic that do not overlap with the source graphic stay untouched.
This value indicates that the source graphic defined in the in attribute is placed over the destination graphic defined in the in2 attribute.
This value indicates that the source graphic defined in the in attribute and the destination graphic defined in the in2 attribute are combined using the following formula:
This value indicates that the spacing between glyphs is adjusted based on kerning tables that are included in the font that will be used.
This value indicates that the sum of the source graphic defined in the in attribute and the destination graphic defined in the in2 attribute is displayed.

This value indicates that the user agent shall attempt to emphasize the contrast between clean edges of artwork over rendering speed and geometric precision. To achieve crisp edges, the user agent might turn off anti-aliasing for all lines and curves or possibly just for straight lines which are close to vertical or horizontal. Also, the user agent might adjust line positions and line widths to align edges with device pixels.

This value indicates that the user agent shall emphasize geometric precision over legibility and rendering speed. This option will usually cause the user agent to suspend the use of hinting so that glyph outlines are drawn with comparable geometric precision to the rendering of path data.

This value indicates that the user agent shall emphasize legibility over rendering speed and geometric precision. The user agent will often choose whether to apply anti-aliasing techniques, built-in font hinting or both to produce the most legible text.
This value indicates that the user agent shall emphasize rendering speed over geometric precision and crisp edges. This option will sometimes cause the user agent to turn off shape anti-aliasing.
This value indicates that the user agent shall emphasize rendering speed over legibility and geometric precision. This option will sometimes cause some user agents to turn off text anti-aliasing.

This value indicates that the user agent shall make appropriate tradeoffs to balance speed, crisp edges and geometric precision, but with geometric precision given more importance than speed and crisp edges.

This value indicates that the user agent shall make appropriate tradeoffs to balance speed, legibility and geometric precision, but with legibility given more importance than speed and geometric precision.

This value indicates that the user agent will automatically adjust the x and y values of the base frequency such that the <feTurbulence> node’s width and height (i.e., the width and height of the current subregion) contain an integral number of the tile width and height for the first octave.

This value indicates that the user coordinate system for the attributes is established using the bounding box of the element to which the gradient is applied and then applying the transform specified by attribute gradientTransform.
This value indicates the name of the CSS property or attribute of the target element to be animated.

This value indicates the number of cells in each dimension for the kernel matrix. The values provided must be <integer>s greater than zero. Values that are not integers will be truncated, i.e. rounded to the closest integer value towards zero. The first number, indicates the number of columns in the matrix. The second number, indicates the number of rows in the matrix. If no second number is not provided, it defaults to the first number.
This value indicates the positioning in horizontal direction of the convolution matrix relative to a given target pixel in the input image.
This value indicates the positioning in vertical direction of the convolution matrix relative to a given target pixel in the input image.

This value is a <custom-ident> and defines the name for the filter primitive. It is only meaningful within a given <filter> element and thus has only local scope. It is legal for the same <filter-primitive-reference> to appear multiple times within the same <filter> element. When referenced, this value will use the closest preceding filter primitive with the given result.
This value is a reference to a <marker> element, which will be drawn at the final vertex. If the reference is not valid, then no marker will be drawn.
This value is a reference to a <marker> element, which will be drawn at the first vertex. If the reference is not valid, then no marker will be drawn.
This value is a reference to a <marker> element, which will be drawn at the given vertices. If the reference is not valid, then no marker will be drawn.

This value is an assigned name for the filter primitive in the form of a <custom-ident>. If supplied, then graphics that result from processing this filter primitive can be referenced by an in attribute on a subsequent filter primitive within the same filter element. If no value is provided, the output will only be available for re-use as the implicit input into the next filter primitive if that filter primitive provides no value for its in attribute.
This value is either a <number> between 0 and 1 or a <percentage> value specifying the opacity of the color gradient stop.
This value is equal to hidden.

This value modifies the way an object is stroked. Normally stroking involves calculating stroke outline of the shapeʼs path in current user coordinate system and filling that outline with the stroke paint (color or gradient). The resulting visual effect of this value is that the stroke width is not dependant on the transformations of the element (including non-uniform scaling and shear transformations) and zoom level.
This value refers to an ICC color profile.

This value specifies a special user coordinate system used by the element and its descendants. The position of user coordinate system is fixed in spite of any transformation changes from a host coordinate space. However, it does not specify the suppression of rotation, skew and scaling. When this vector effect and the transform property are defined at the same time, that property is consumed for this effect.

This value specifies a special user coordinate system used by the element and its descendants. The rotation and skew of that user coordinate system is suppressed in spite of any transformation changes from a host coordinate space. However, it does not specify the suppression of scaling. Also, it does not specify the origin of user coordinate system.

This value specifies a special user coordinate system used by the element and its descendants. The scale of that user coordinate system does not change in spite of any transformation changes from a host coordinate space. However, it does not specify the suppression of rotation and skew. Also, it does not specify the origin of the user coordinate system. Since this value suppresses scaling of the user coordinate system, it also has the characteristics of non-scaling-stroke.
This value specifies that instead of linking to the resource it will be loaded and shown within the document. This is similar to the effect achieved by an HTML <img> element.

This value specifies that no vector effect shall be applied, i.e. the default rendering behaviour is used which is to first fill the geometry of a shape with a specified paint, then stroke the outline with a specified paint.

This value specifies that the markerWidth and markerUnits attributes and the contents of the <marker> element represent values in a coordinate system which has a single unit equal the size in user units of the current stroke width (see the stroke-width attribute) in place for the graphic object referencing the marker.

This value specifies that the markerWidth and markerUnits attributes and the contents of the <marker> element represent values in the current user coordinate system in place for the graphic object referencing the marker (i.e., the user coordinate system for the element referencing the <marker> element via a marker, marker-start, marker-mid, or marker-end property).
This value specifies that the gradient repeats in the original order beyond its edges.

This value specifies that the implementation should match the attributeName to an attribute for the target element. User agents first search through the list of CSS properties for a matching property name, and if none is found, search the default XML namespace for the element.
This value specifies that the referenced resource is opened in a new window or tab. This is similar to the effect achieved by an HTML <a> element with target set to _blank.
This value specifies that the referenced resource is opened in the same window or tab. This is similar to the effect achieved by an HTML <a> element with target set to _self.
This value specifies that the value of attributeName is the name of a CSS property defined as animatable.
This value specifies that the value of attributeName is the name of an XML attribute defined as animatable in the default XML namespace for the target element.
This value specifies that there is no indication for how to refer to the linked resource.
This value specifies the duration in presentation time to repeat the animation.
This value specifies the language used for the element. The syntax of this value is defined in the BCP 47 specification.

This value specifies the length of the simple duration. The value must be greater than 0 and can be expressed with hours (h), minutes (m), seconds (s) or milliseconds (ms). Itʼs possible to combine those time representations to create some complex durations like hh:mm:ss.iii or mm:ss.iii.

This value specifies the number of iterations. It can include partial iterations expressed as fraction values. A fractional value describes a portion of the simple duration. Values must be greater than 0.
This value specifies the simple duration as indefinite.
This value specifies the simple duration as the intrinsic media duration. This is only valid for elements that define media.
This value specifies the title used to describe the meaning of the link or resource.
This value specifies the unique ID for a locally stored color profile as specified by International Color Consortium.
This value specifies the width of the space the text will be adjusted to occupy as absolute length or percentage.

This value takes one or two values, the first one outlining the resolution in horizontal direction, the second one in vertical direction. If only one value is specified, it is used for both directions.
This value tells the user agent to convert all newline and tab characters into spaces. Then, it draws all space characters (including leading, trailing and multiple consecutive space characters).
This value thins the source graphic defined in the in attribute.
This value uses the top of the em box as the baseline.

trans-unit.source: To make this work in the example above, we had to consider the size of our box (200 pixels) and the fact that we wanted the pattern to repeat itself 4 times horizontally and vertically. This means that each pattern unit was a 50×50 square. The two rects and the circle inside the pattern were then sized to fit in a 50×50 box. Anything we had drawn outside that box wouldn't have been shown. The pattern also had to be offset by 10 pixels so that it would start in the upper-left corner of our box, so the x and y attributes of the pattern had to be adjusted to 10÷200 = 0.05.
To render text along the shape of a <path>, enclose the text in a <textPath> element that has an href attribute with a reference to the <path> element.

To use a gradient, we have to reference it from an object's fill or stroke attributes. This is done the same way you reference elements in CSS, using a url. In this case, the url is just a reference to our gradient, which I've given the creative ID, "Gradient". To attach it, set the fill to url(#Gradient), and voila! Our object is now multicolored. You can do the same with stroke.
trans-unit.target: Para usar un degradado, tenemos que hacer referencia a él desde los atributos de fill o stroke de un objeto . Esto se hace de la misma manera que hace referencia a elementos en CSS, usando una url . En este caso, la URL es solo una referencia a nuestro gradiente, al que le he dado el ID de creatividad, "Gradiente". Para adjuntarlo, configure el fill en url(#Gradient) y ¡listo! Nuestro objeto ahora es multicolor. Puedes hacer lo mismo con el stroke .

Unlike gradients, patterns have a second attribute, patternContentUnits, which describes the units system used inside the pattern element, on the basic shapes themselves. This attribute defaults to "userSpaceOnUse", the opposite of the patternUnits attribute. What this means is that unless you specify one or both of these attributes (patternContentUnits and patternUnits), the shapes you draw inside your pattern are being drawn in a different coordinate system than the pattern element is using, which can make things a bit confusing when you're writing this by hand.

Unlike gradients, patterns then have a second attribute, patternContentUnits, which describes the units system used inside the pattern element, on the basic shapes themselves. This attribute defaults to "userSpaceOnUse", the opposite of the patternUnits attribute. What this means is that unless you specify one or both of these attributes (patternContentUnits and patternUnits), the shapes you draw inside your pattern are being drawn in a different coordinate system than the pattern element is using, which can make things a bit confusing when you're writing this by hand. To make this work in the example above, we had to consider the size of our box (200 pixels) and the fact that we wanted the pattern to repeat itself 4 times horizontally and vertically. This means that each pattern unit was a 50x50 square. The two rects and the circle inside the pattern were then sized to fit in a 50x50 box. Anything we had drawn outside that box wouldn't have been shown. The pattern also had to be offset by 10 pixels so that it would start in the upper-left corner of our box, so the x and y attributes of the pattern had to be adjusted to 10/200 = 0.05.
trans-unit.target: A diferencia de los degradados, los patrones tienen un segundo atributo, patternContentUnits , que describe el sistema de unidades utilizado dentro del elemento del patrón, en las formas básicas mismas. Este atributo tiene como valor predeterminado "userSpaceOnUse", lo opuesto al atributo patternUnits . Lo que esto significa es que, a menos que especifique uno o ambos de estos atributos ( patternContentUnits y patternUnits ), las formas que dibuja dentro de su patrón se dibujan en un sistema de coordenadas diferente al que usa el elemento del patrón, lo que puede hacer que las cosas sean un poco confusas cuando escribe esto a mano. Para que esto funcione en el ejemplo anterior, tuvimos que considerar el tamaño de nuestra caja (200 píxeles) y el hecho de que queríamos que el patrón se repitiera 4 veces horizontal y verticalmente. Esto significa que cada unidad de patrón era un cuadrado de 50x50. A continuación, se dimensionaron las dos rectas y el círculo dentro del patrón para que quepa en una caja de 50x50. Cualquier cosa que hubiéramos dibujado fuera de esa caja no se habría mostrado. El patrón también tuvo que ser compensado por 10 píxeles para que comenzara en la esquina superior izquierda de nuestro cuadro, por lo que los atributos xey del patrón tuvieron que ajustarse a 10/200 = 0.05.

trans-unit.source: Unlike other positioning attributes, refX is interpreted as being in the coordinate system of the symbol contents, after application of the viewBox and preserveAspectRatio attributes. If the attribute is not specified, no horizontal adjustment is made, and the left side of the symbol’s rectangular viewport region (regardless of the viewBox coordinate) is positioned at the x coordinate.

trans-unit.source: We now have a semicircle without having to deal with arcs in path elements. For the clipping, every path inside the clipPath is inspected and evaluated together with its stroke properties and transformation. Then every part of the target lying in a transparent area of the resulting clipPath's content will not be rendered. Color, opacity and such have no effect as long as they don't let parts vanish completely.
trans-unit.target: Ahora tenemos un semicírculo sin tener que lidiar con arcos en elementos de ruta. Para el recorte, cada trazado dentro del clipPath se inspecciona y evalúa junto con sus propiedades de trazo y transformación. Entonces no se renderizará cada parte del destino que se encuentre en un área transparente del contenido del clipPath resultante . El color, la opacidad y demás no tienen ningún efecto siempre que no permitan que las partes desaparezcan por completo.

trans-unit.source: We start with the <font> element. This bears an id attribute, to enable it to be referenced via a URI (see below). The horiz-adv-x attribute determines how wide a character is on average compared to the path definitions of the single glyphs. The value 1000 sets a reasonable value to work with. There are several accompanying attributes that help further define the basic glyph-box layout.
trans-unit.target: Comenzamos con el elemento <font> . Esto lleva un atributo id, para permitir que se haga referencia a él a través de un URI (ver más abajo). El atributo horiz-adv-x determina qué tan ancho es un carácter en promedio en comparación con las definiciones de ruta de los glifos individuales. El valor 1000 establece un valor razonable con el que trabajar. Hay varios atributos adjuntos que ayudan a definir mejor el diseño básico del cuadro de glifos.

trans-unit.source: When gradientUnits="objectBoundingBox" and gradientTransform is the identity matrix, the normal of the linear gradient is perpendicular to the gradient vector in object bounding box space (i.e., the abstract coordinate system where (0,0) is at the top/left of the object bounding box and (1,1) is at the bottom/right of the object bounding box). When the object's bounding box is not square, the gradient normal which is initially perpendicular to the gradient vector within object bounding box space may render non-perpendicular relative to the gradient vector in user space. If the gradient vector is parallel to one of the axes of the bounding box, the gradient normal will remain perpendicular. This transformation is due to application of the non-uniform scaling transformation from bounding box space to user space.
trans-unit.target: Cuando gradientUnits="objectBoundingBox" y gradientTransform es la matriz de identidad, la normal del gradiente lineal es perpendicular al vector de gradiente en el espacio del cuadro delimitador del objeto (es decir, el sistema de coordenadas abstracto donde (0,0) está en la parte superior / izquierda del cuadro delimitador del objeto y (1, 1) está en la parte inferior / derecha del cuadro delimitador del objeto). Cuando el cuadro delimitador del objeto no es cuadrado, la normal de degradado que inicialmente es perpendicular al vector de degradado dentro del espacio del cuadro delimitador del objeto puede volverse no perpendicular en relación con el vector de degradado en el espacio del usuario. Si el vector de degradado es paralelo a uno de los ejes del cuadro delimitador, la normal del degradado permanecerá perpendicular. Esta transformación se debe a la aplicación de la transformación de escala no uniforme del espacio del cuadro delimitador al espacio del usuario.

trans-unit.source: When gradientUnits="objectBoundingBox" and gradientTransform is the identity matrix, then the rings of the radial gradient are circular with respect to the object bounding box space (i.e., the abstract coordinate system where (0,0) is at the top/left of the object bounding box and (1,1) is at the bottom/right of the object bounding box). When the object's bounding box is not square, the rings that are conceptually circular within object bounding box space will render as elliptical due to application of the non-uniform scaling transformation from bounding box space to user space.
trans-unit.target: Cuando gradientUnits="objectBoundingBox" y gradientTransform es la matriz de identidad, entonces los anillos del degradado radial son circulares con respecto al espacio del cuadro delimitador del objeto (es decir, el sistema de coordenadas abstracto donde (0,0) está en la parte superior / izquierda de el cuadro delimitador del objeto y (1,1) está en la parte inferior / derecha del cuadro delimitador del objeto). Cuando el cuadro delimitador del objeto no es cuadrado, los anillos que son conceptualmente circulares dentro del espacio del cuadro delimitador del objeto se mostrarán como elípticos debido a la aplicación de la transformación de escala no uniforme del espacio del cuadro delimitador al espacio del usuario.

trans-unit.source: When scroll is specified on an <svg> element, a scrollbar or panner is normally shown for the SVG viewport whether or not any of its content is clipped.

When SVG was specified, support for web fonts was not widespread in browsers. Since accessing the correct font file is however crucial for rendering text correctly, a font description technology was added to SVG to provide this ability. It was not meant for compatibility with other formats like PostScript or OTF, but rather as a simple means of embedding glyph information into SVG when rendered.
trans-unit.target: Cuando se especificó SVG,el apoyo a las fuentes web no estaba muy extendido en los navegadores.Sin embargo,dado que el acceso al archivo de fuente correcto es crucial para la representación correcta del texto,se añadió una tecnología de descripción de fuente a SVG para proporcionar esta capacidad.No estaba pensada para la compatibilidad con otros formatos como PostScript u OTF,sino más bien como un medio sencillo de incrustar información de glifos en SVG cuando se renderiza.

trans-unit.source: When a <length> is provided, its value is added to the inter-character spacing value specified by the letter-spacing attribute.
trans-unit.target: Cuando se proporciona un <length> , su valor se agrega al valor de espaciado entre caracteres especificado por el atributo de letter-spacing .

trans-unit.source: When a child element is blended into a background, the value of the color-interpolation attribute on the child determines the type of blending, not the value of the color-interpolation on the parent. For gradients which make use of the xlink:href attribute to reference another gradient, the gradient uses the color-interpolation attribute value from the gradient element which is directly referenced by the fill or stroke attribute. When animating colors, color interpolation is performed according to the value of the color-interpolation attribute on the element being animated.
trans-unit.target: Cuando un elemento hijo se mezcla con un fondo, el valor del atributo de color-interpolation en el hijo determina el tipo de combinación, no el valor de la color-interpolation en el padre. Para degradados que hacen uso del atributo xlink:href para hacer referencia a otro degradado, el degradado utiliza el valor del atributo de color-interpolation del elemento degradado al que hace referencia directamente el atributo de fill o stroke . Al animar colores, la interpolación de color se realiza de acuerdo con el valor del atributo de color-interpolation en el elemento que se está animando .

trans-unit.source: When a child element is blended into a background, the value of the color-interpolation property on the child determines the type of blending, not the value of the color-interpolation on the parent. For gradients which make use of the href or the deprecated xlink:href attribute to reference another gradient, the gradient uses the propertyʼs value from the gradient element which is directly referenced by the fill or stroke property. When animating colors, color interpolation is performed according to the value of the color-interpolation property on the element being animated.
When a list of values is defined via the values attribute, the from attribute is ignored.

When an "input" event occurs, we call SVGLength.newValueSpecifiedUnits() to set the value of textLength to the slider's new value, using the SVGLength interface's SVG_LENGTHTYPE_PX unit type to indicate that the value represents pixels. Note that we have to dive into textLength to get its baseVal property; textLength is stored as an SVGLength object, so we can't treat it like a plain number.
trans-unit.target: Cuando una "input" se produce el evento, que llamamos SVGLength.newValueSpecifiedUnits() para establecer el valor de textLength a nuevo valor de la corredera, utilizando el SVGLength de interfaz SVG_LENGTHTYPE_PX tipo de unidad para indicar que el valor representa píxeles. Tenga en cuenta que tenemos que sumergirnos en textLength para obtener su propiedad baseVal ; textLength se almacena como un objeto SVGLength , por lo que no podemos tratarlo como un número simple.

trans-unit.source: When an SVG <text>or <tspan> element has a specific length, set using the textLength attribute, the lengthAdjust attribute controls how the text is stretched or compressed into that length.
trans-unit.target: Cuando un elemento SVG <text> o <tspan> tiene una longitud específica, establecida mediante el atributo textLength , el atributo lengthAdjust controla cómo se estira o comprime el texto en esa longitud.

trans-unit.source: When an outermost svg element is embedded inline within HTML, if the overflow attribute has the value hidden or scroll, then the browser will establish an initial clipping path equal to the bounds of the initial viewport; otherwise, the initial clipping path is set according to the CSS clipping rules.
trans-unit.target: Cuando un elemento svg más externo está incrustado en línea dentro de HTML, si el atributo de overflow tiene el valor hidden o scroll , el navegador establecerá una ruta de recorte inicial igual a los límites de la ventana gráfica inicial; de lo contrario, la ruta de recorte inicial se establece de acuerdo con las reglas de recorte de CSS.

trans-unit.source: When an outermost svg element is stand-alone, the overflow attribute on the outermost svg element is ignored for the purposes of visual rendering and the initial clipping path is set to the bounds of the initial viewport.
trans-unit.target: Cuando un elemento svg más externo es independiente, el atributo de overflow en el elemento svg más externo se ignora a los efectos de la representación visual y la ruta de recorte inicial se establece en los límites de la ventana gráfica inicial.

trans-unit.source: When applied to a container element, setting display to none causes the container and all of its children to be invisible; thus, it acts on groups of elements as a group. This means that any child of an element with display="none" will never be rendered even if the child has a value for display other than none.
trans-unit.target: Cuando se aplica a un elemento contenedor, configurar display en none hace que el contenedor y todos sus elementos secundarios sean invisibles; por tanto, actúa sobre grupos de elementos como grupo. Esto significa que cualquier hijo de un elemento con display="none" nunca se renderizará incluso si el hijo tiene un valor para display que none sea ninguno .

trans-unit.source: When talking about text in SVG we have to differentiate two almost completely separate topics. The one is the inclusion and display of text in an image, and the other are SVG fonts. The latter may be described in a later section of the tutorial, while we will focus completely on the first part: Bringing text into an SVG image.
trans-unit.target: Cuando hablamos de texto en SVG tenemos que diferenciar dos temas casi completamente separados.Uno es la inclusión y visualización de texto en una imagen,y el otro son las fuentes SVG.Este último puede ser descrito en una sección posterior del tutorial,mientras que nos centraremos completamente en la primera parte:La inclusión de texto en una imagen SVG.

trans-unit.source: When the display attribute is set to none, then the given element does not become part of the rendering tree. It has implications for the <tspan>, <tref>, and <altGlyph> elements, event processing, for bounding box calculations and for calculation of clipping paths:
trans-unit.target: Cuando el atributo de display se establece en none , el elemento dado no se convierte en parte del árbol de representación. Tiene implicaciones para los elementos <tspan> , <tref> y <altGlyph> , el procesamiento de eventos, para los cálculos del cuadro delimitador y para el cálculo de las rutas de recorte:

trans-unit.source: When the current SVG document fragment is rendered as SVG on visual media, <desc> elements are not rendered as part of the graphics. Alternate presentations are possible, both visual and aural, which display the <desc> element but do not display <path> elements or other graphics elements. The <desc> element generally improves accessibility of SVG documents.
trans-unit.target: Cuando el fragmento de documento SVG actual se representa como SVG en medios visuales, los elementos <desc> no se representan como parte de los gráficos. Son posibles presentaciones alternativas, tanto visuales como auditivas, que muestran el elemento <desc> pero no muestran elementos <path> u otros elementos gráficos. El elemento <desc> generalmente mejora la accesibilidad de los documentos SVG.

trans-unit.source: When two line segments meet at a sharp angle and miter joins have been specified for stroke-linejoin, it is possible for the miter to extend far beyond the thickness of the line stroking the path. The stroke-miterlimit ratio is used to define when the limit is exceeded, if so the join is converted from a miter to a bevel.
trans-unit.target: Cuando dos segmentos de línea se encuentran en un ángulo agudo y se han especificado uniones de miter unir stroke-linejoin , es posible que el inglete se extienda mucho más allá del grosor de la línea que traza el trazado. La relación stroke-miterlimit se utiliza para definir cuándo se excede el límite, si es así, la unión se convierte de un inglete a un bisel.

trans-unit.source: When using transformations you establish a new coordinate system inside the element the transformations apply to. That means, the units you specify for the element and its children might not follow the 1:1 pixel mapping, but are also distorted, skewed, translated and scaled according to the transformation.
trans-unit.target: Cuando se usan transformaciones se establece un nuevo sistema de coordenadas dentro del elemento al que se aplican las transformaciones.Esto significa que las unidades que especificas para el elemento y sus hijos pueden no seguir el mapeo de 1:1 píxeles,pero también están distorsionadas,sesgadas,traducidas y escaladas de acuerdo a la transformación.

With this value and gradientTransform being the identity matrix, the normal of the linear gradient is perpendicular to the gradient vector in object bounding box space (i.e., the abstract coordinate system where (0,0) is at the top/left of the object bounding box and (1,1) is at the bottom/right of the object bounding box). When the object's bounding box is not square, the gradient normal which is initially perpendicular to the gradient vector within object bounding box space may render non-perpendicular relative to the gradient vector in user space. If the gradient vector is parallel to one of the axes of the bounding box, the gradient normal will remain perpendicular. This transformation is due to application of the non-uniform scaling transformation from bounding box space to user space.

With this value and gradientTransform being the identity matrix, the rings of the radial gradient are circular with respect to the object bounding box space (i.e., the abstract coordinate system where (0,0) is at the top/left of the object bounding box and (1,1) is at the bottom/right of the object bounding box). When the object's bounding box is not square, the rings that are conceptually circular within object bounding box space will render as elliptical due to application of the non-uniform scaling transformation from bounding box space to user space.

trans-unit.target: Dentro del DOM de SVG, los valores de <paint> se representan utilizando objetos SVGPaint .

trans-unit.source: Within the SVG DOM, a <coordinate> is represented as an SVGLength or an SVGAnimatedLength.
trans-unit.target: Dentro del DOM SVG, una <coordinate> se representa como SVGLength o SVGAnimatedLength .

trans-unit.source: Within the SVG DOM, a <number> is represented as a float, SVGNumber or a SVGAnimatedNumber.
trans-unit.target: Dentro de SVG DOM, un <number> se representa como un flotante, SVGNumber o SVGAnimatedNumber .

trans-unit.source: Within the SVG DOM, a <percentage> is represented using an SVGNumber or SVGAnimatedNumber object.
trans-unit.target: Dentro del DOM de SVG, un <percentage> se representa mediante un objeto SVGNumber o SVGAnimatedNumber .

trans-unit.source: Within the SVG DOM, a <transform-list> value is represented using an SVGTransformList or SVGAnimatedTransformList object.
trans-unit.target: Dentro del DOM de SVG, un valor de <transform-list> se representa mediante un objeto SVGTransformList o SVGAnimatedTransformList .

trans-unit.source: Within the SVG DOM, an <integer> is represented as a number or an SVGAnimatedInteger.
trans-unit.target: Dentro del DOM de SVG, un <integer> se representa como un number o un SVGAnimatedInteger .

trans-unit.source: Within the SVG DOM, values of a <list-of-Ts> type are represented by an interface specific for the particular type T. For example, a <list-of-lengths> is represented in the SVG DOM using an SVGLengthList or SVGAnimatedLengthList object.
trans-unit.target: Dentro del DOM de SVG, los valores de un tipo <lista de T s> están representados por una interfaz específica para el tipo T particular . Por ejemplo, una <list-of-lengths> se representa en el DOM de SVG utilizando un objeto SVGLengthList o SVGAnimatedLengthList .

trans-unit.source: You can check that your server is sending the correct HTTP headers with your SVG files by using the Network Monitor panel or a site such as websniffer.cc. Submit the URL of one of your SVG files and look at the HTTP response headers. If you find that your server is not sending the headers with the values given above, then you should contact your Web host. If you have problems convincing them to correctly configure their servers for SVG, there may be ways to do it yourself. See the server configuration page on the w3.org for a range of simple solutions.
trans-unit.target: Puede verificar que su servidor envíe los encabezados HTTP correctos con sus archivos SVG utilizando el panel Monitor de red o un sitio como websniffer.cc . Envíe la URL de uno de sus archivos SVG y observe los encabezados de respuesta HTTP. Si encuentra que su servidor no envía los encabezados con los valores dados arriba, entonces debe contactar a su proveedor de alojamiento web. Si tiene problemas para convencerlos de que configuren correctamente sus servidores para SVG, puede haber formas de hacerlo usted mismo. Consulte la página de configuración del servidor en w3.org para conocer una variedad de soluciones simples.

En este caso, puede usar una versión de acceso directo del Bézier cúbico, designado por el comando S (o s ).
